Package entity.ghost

Class GhostEntity

java.lang.Object
entity.Entity
entity.ghost.GhostEntity
All Implemented Interfaces:
CollisionElement, EngineComponent
Direct Known Subclasses:
DirectGhostEntity, FlankGhostEntity
public abstract class GhostEntity
extends Entity
The abstract GhostEntity class is used to store the pathfinding logic used by the various different ghosts. For instance, one ghost may follow Pacman directly, while another pathfinds to a location in-front of Pacman. When pathfinding, the cost of a path will be increased significantly if another ghost is already in that path. This encourages the ghosts to split up, even if the path isn't the most direct.
Author:
Harry Felton - 18032692

    • GhostEntity

      public GhostEntity​(PacmanGame game, int x, int y)

  • Method Details

    • setGhostSprites

      public void setGhostSprites​(java.util.Map<Entity.DIRECTION,​int[][]> spriteMap)
      Given a Map of key,value pairs, this method will iterate over them. The value, a 2D int array, is used to determine the positions of the sprites to be loaded. The key, a DIRECTION enum, is used as the key in the sprites array existing on this instance. This allows the GhostEntity to use a certain selection of sprites based on it's direction of movement.
      Parameters:
      spriteMap - The Map which will be iterated over and loaded from.

    • getTargetGridPosition

      private java.awt.Point getTargetGridPosition()
      Returns the grid-based position of the pacman, OR a point to flee to if the Pacman is invulnerable.
      Returns:
      The target point to track

    • calculatePath

      protected void calculatePath​(java.awt.Point proposedPoint)
      Gets the position of the Pacman entity, grid relative, and attempts to use the PathFinder class to seek the entity out.
      Parameters:
      proposedPoint - The location that the ghost is trying to seek to

    • calculatePath

      protected void calculatePath()

    • pacmanStateChange

      public void pacmanStateChange​(PacmanEntity e)
      This function is called by the PacmanEntity when it's state has changed; this allows all the ghosts to re-evaluate their status (tracking or fleeing) based on a callback, rather than polling the entity for it's state every tick.
      Parameters:
      e - The PacmanEntity instance that brought this state change on

    • queueRandomTurn

      protected void queueRandomTurn()
      If no path was found for the ghost, or if the ghost is a RANDOM_SEEKER not yet in range of the Pacman, then this method will create a new random point near and adjacent to the Pacman to follow.

    • findDirectionOfTarget

      private Entity.DIRECTION findDirectionOfTarget​(java.awt.Point target)
      Returns the direction that this ghost must move in order to move closer to the target Point provided
      Parameters:
      target - The target we're moving towards
      Returns:
      The direction the ghost must move

    • moveGhost

      private void moveGhost​(Entity.DIRECTION d, int distance)
      Moves the ghost by the distance provided in the direction provided
      Parameters:
      d - The direction to move in
      distance - The distance by which to move

    • trackTarget

      private void trackTarget()
      Moves the ghost closer to the current step we're working towards; if we reach a step in this turn, we'll re-calculate our path and request the next step. This is achieved by setting the direction of the ghost to that of the nearest step. If the ghost is in random mode, is out of range, or could not find a path, a random direction will be queued instead.

    • moveTowardsStep

      private void moveTowardsStep​(int diffDistance)
      This method will attempt to move the ghost towards a point. If the point is so close that one movement (by distance velocity) will move past it, this method will redirect that excess distance to the direction specified by the next path finding step.
      Parameters:
      diffDistance - The amount of distance between current location and target location

    • update

      public void update​(double dt)
      Handles each tick update delivered to this entity. The ghost will be moved closer to the goal (path finding, or a random goal if the Pacman is out of range). This method will also handle the sprite animations that occur while the ghost is moving.
      Parameters:
      dt - The amount of time (ms) since last update tick.

    • paintComponent

      public void paintComponent()

    • collidedWithGameBoundary

      public boolean collidedWithGameBoundary​(java.awt.Rectangle collisionBox, CollisionController.COLLISION_TYPE CollisionType)
      Description copied from interface: CollisionElement
      Called by the CollisionController when the collisionBox is colliding with the boundary of the game
      Parameters:
      collisionBox - The collision box intersecting the boundary
      CollisionType - The type of the collision
      Returns:
      Returns true if the collision event is consumed, false otherwise

    • collidedWithBy

      public boolean collidedWithBy​(java.awt.Rectangle collisionBox, CollisionElement source, java.awt.Rectangle infringedBoundary)
      A notification method that is executed when this entity is collided with. Test if the source is the PacmanEntity we're seeking out. If so, notify game of loss condition.
      Parameters:
      collisionBox - The collision box
      source - The source of the collision
      infringedBoundary - The boundary infringed by the collision
      Returns:
      Whether or not this collision has been consumed. If true, no more processing of this collision should occur.

    • isCollisionBoxIntersecting

      public java.awt.Rectangle isCollisionBoxIntersecting​(java.awt.Rectangle collision, CollisionElement source)
      Description copied from interface: CollisionElement
      Used to test if the collision box has collided with this entity
      Parameters:
      collision - The collision box to test against
      source - The source of the collision box
      Returns:
      Returns true if the collision box is intersecting this entity, false otherwise
